required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: A study comparing the emPOWER Ankle System to standard carbon fiber prosthetic feet, in active seniors.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to show increased mobility and improvement in balance and other activities of daily living with the emPOWER Ankle, a powered prosthesis, compared to standard carbon fiber prosthetic feet, in active seniors.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of this trial will be an improvement in walking distance with the emPOWER Ankle over the distance covered with the subject's passive prosthesis as shown by 6MWT results.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Timed performance test of walking up and down an ADA compliant ramp 3 times

secondary_outcome.measure: Prosthetic Limb Users Survey of Mobility PLUS-M (12 item Short Form)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment and at 3, 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Survey Instrument: Prosthetic Limb Users Survey of Mobility PLUS-M (12 item Short Form)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Survey Instrument: Activities-specific Balance Confidence Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment and at 3, 6 and 12 months
2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment and at 3, 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Survey Instrument: PROMIS Global Health Short Form

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment and at 3, 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Survey Instrument: PROMIS Fatigue Short Form (7a)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd and 3rd study visits which will take place within 45 days of enrollment and at 3, 6 and 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Survey Instrument: PROMIS Pain Intensity Short Form (3a)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3rd study visit which will take place within 45 days of enrollment

intervention.description: The device is 510k cleared and is intended to replace a missing foot and ankle. The emPOWER Ankle is to be used exclusively for fittings of lower-extremity amputations as prescribed by a healthcare professional.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females
- 62 years or older
- Subjects with transtibial amputations of either leg at least 1 year prior
- Socket Comfort Score of at least 6
- Sock fluctuation of â‰¤ 8 ply per day
- K-level rating of 3 or 4 based on the Amputee Mobility Predictor Assessment Tool
- Ability to walk at a walking speed of > 0.75 meters per second
- Unilateral amputees (up to 7 bilateral amputees can be included, 1 per site in addition to the unilateral amputees who will be analyzed as a separate sub group)
- Foot size: 25-30 cm
- Ability to complete a continuous 6-Minute Walk Test
- Ability to provide written, informed consent
- Ability to complete study visits and study documents
- Ability to manage the complexity of a powered device including charging and changing batteries as needed
- Ability to read and understand English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have never used a prosthetic device
- Less than 62 years of age
- Weight <150 lbs. or > 287 lbs.
- Transfemoral amputees
- Active sores or ulceration on subject's residual limb
- Sore on contralateral foot.
- Cuff-link socket suspension
- Socket Comfort Score less than 6
- Sock fluctuation of > 8 per day
- K level of 1 or 2
- Amputation clearance < 8.625"
- History of stroke or TIA that impairs current walking
- Recent history of excessive falling defined as more than 2 falls requiring medical assistance in the prior year
- Medications potentially affecting balance
- Recent hospitalization (within past 3 months)
- Cognitive deficiency that would impact ability to charge and change batteries as needed

facility.name: University of Nebraska Omaha, Biomechanics Research
University of Oregon, Bowerman Sports Science Clinic
